Reviews.Title: “Everything you'll need!”
Reviews.Author: skidancer1
Reviews.Content: HIE Playa was all we ever needed on our recent vacation in Mexico! Breakfast was amazing! The pool is beautiful! Rooms are very nice! Beds are comfy! Within a few blocks walking to the Village and the beach! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “good place for the price”
Reviews.Author: kirsten
Reviews.Content: so i and another woman needed a safe clean place to stay near playa del carmen and we checked into this hotel..I have to say it was very nice for the price and if you must go as a woman alone or with another it was a good place to stay-almost everyone was friendly-the beds were very comfy, and generally it was a good place EXCEPT for the face that we were told it was $85 dollars a night and when we checked out it ended up being $133 a night ..and when we questioned it this particular employee was not the friendliest and it never really got explained why the price went up-so having said that for 85 bucks a night it was good at 133. I wouldn't do it again!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Don M
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel facilities to always be clean & fresh. The rooms are bright & comfortable with large bathroom areas. The staff were always couteous, polite & helpful at all times. The breakfast buffet included provides a great start to the day. The pool area is well designed & great place to spend time away from the hustle & bustle of the downtown area. The location is a short 10 minute walk to town or a free shuttle service. Free internet service is also provided. This hotel offers exceptional value at reasonable rates!!! Having stayed at this hotel numerous times since 2007, we find the consistent quality to be outstanding & highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't need air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: holsv2
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel and upon arrival thought it looked nice and clean. We were greeted nice enough and check-in went smooth; however being priority club members we were not offered our club benefits. The hotel is clean, the staff is relatively friendly and you have a feeling of safety on the hotel grounds. The pool was very nice the day we arrived however when we awoke the next morning it was closed due to repairs. Our room was big and accomadating but was very hot due to no air conditioning causing a restless night. The shower had very little water pressure at all. I used the gym in the morning and it was kind of like excersing in a sauna. The breakfast was just OK but the staff kept everything clean and full.

Reviews.Title: “Average Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chaserr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and the rooms are comfortable. Breakfast is included but the food is awful.

Reviews.Title: “Consider this hotel if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: DonCapeMayBeach
Reviews.Content: I am here on business, so location wasn't important. However, considering it is a 1.5 km walk or a MXN 70-80 taxi ride each time into town AND the fact this hotel has no restaurant or bar, I made a mistake. Otherwise it was fine considering my previous hotel experiences here. The staff were all nice. There is a lovely, small pool. Parking appears to be free. Still, a cab ride is about the same as parking in town. The rooms are nice with minimal wear. The bed was comfy. WIFI is free but didn't work well in my room. There is a better version in the lobby so I spent a lot of time there. Breakfast was nice. Fruits, cereals, scrambled eggs, salsa verde, steamed nachos with queso fresca, sweet I reads, yoghurt. There is a moldy smell to the room, but I didn't find mold. It seems typical for the area. I suspect it is due to the fact the window doesn't open and they turn the air off when not in the room so it is generally moist and stale - ideal for mold. That being said I have not yet been in a hotel here that doesn't have the same issue. I would stay here again depending on where I need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Sam C
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most affordable hotels in the Mayan Riviera I was able to find online, which had a parking lot. I stayed here for one night only on 1/26/12. I highly recommend this hotel if you are driving and/or you will spend most of your time visiting nearby attractions (such as Xcaret, Coba, Tulum, etc). The hotel is clean, with really good service and delicious breakfast included. Wi-Fi is fast enough. The pool is small but nice, although it could have been much larger, given the outdoors space. Parking is free. Only downside is that it's right next to the highway, far away from nice beaches and at least a good 10-minute walk away from downtown. They offer shuttles to downtown Playa del Carmen, and feature free access to Coco Maya beach club; unfortunately the beach is not that nice in front of the club. I would recommend to ask the driver to take you to Playa Mamitas; there are two beach clubs there, and also a good strip of beautiful public beach if you don't need an umbrella or other services. Beach Towels are provided at the front desk. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, simple, easy to access, good price”
Reviews.Author: db1337
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express pretty much delivers exactly what is intended by the brand. It's easy access just off the highway coming through Playa del Carmen. You are a 5 minute walk from a very large Wall Mart style store (Chedraui) if you want to stock up on consumables. It's a long trip to the beach though, so this may be bad for you. For me it was OK since I had a car and was in town to scuba dive rather than visit the beach. Rooms are simple, clean, quiet. The pool area is actually pretty nice and overall it's a great value stay. Not a fancy five star resort so expectations need to be set right, but what you are looking for with this brand is hit on exactly. Check in and out were quick, WiFi worked excellently and was complimentary. Beds comfortable and I slept well. I had zero issues with the hotel, and got exactly what I expected at this price point, so 5/5 for the Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel located in a quiet area of PDC”
Reviews.Author: mayaruinsonly
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here at this hotel on 4 different occasions and I've never had any complaints at all. The rooms are large, clean, nicely decorated and very quiet as well. The buffet-style breakfast they offer is very good too. I always enjoy the short walk from the hotel into town as it is safe and refreshing to do so. The price of the rooms are very reasonable as well. Mayaruinsonly Destination Expert - Guatemala

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay & cheap !”
Reviews.Author: temple1120
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times, very simple but clean and convenient and a great stepping off point for the trip south to chetumal. Attentive caring staff, clean and decent pool for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for PDC”
Reviews.Author: ERCUR
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with others who give this a great rating. Given that a good number of hotels in PDC are not beachfront except for the all inclusives or 5*s, you can't beat the price of the Holiday Inn or the facilities. It is immaculate, quiet, nice size modern rooms, great staff. Yes, it is not on the beach and someowhat near highway but you cannot hear the highway at all. The pool area is somewhat small but it is beautiful back there in the mornings and for late afternoons before when you return from the beach and want to crack open a beer. We stayed last Feb for 4 nights and are returning this Feb as well. A little walk from downtown but after dinner and margaritas so what? Shuttle to beach club is a nice feature and the Beach Club, although not as fancy as Kool or Wicky's is sufficient. They have the best Fish Tacos and staff is very nice there. If I were staying in PDC for a week and just wanted to crash at a resort type place, I might like someplace with more amenities but if you are like us and do some travelling around the area to Akumal, etc.. this can't be beat..

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from my 3rd stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cincitime
Reviews.Content: As most of the reviews say, this is not the best location but it has a lot to offer. You can stay on or off of 5th for 25.00 and up but I was warned that the music at near by properties goes to 5AM! If you want a top notch, quiet US style room, you can't go wrong with this very well managed property. It has always been spotless, the front desk is excellent and everyone speaks very good English. The people at the beach club are terrific and food and drinks are not unreasonably priced, umbrellas at no charge "although would expect that you would buy something" ($20.00 in Miami and no services). The shuttle will take you one way there and it's 700 pesos for a taxi back or about a 25 minute walk. Shuttle runs from about 9:00 to 5:00 each hour and they are happy to drop you off near the bus station or along 5th. Walking to 5th is less then 15 minutes. I'm brand loyal to Priority Club and staying here helps me earn my points so for me it's very much worth the trade off of locations.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gferraez
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a lot, for business, i wanted to write this because every time there is an angry tourist, staying here, this is no a hotel for tourist, is a hotel for business, the hotel is perfectly located and its very clean and tidy, but it is near the main highway no the beaches, and the facilities are for what a business person needs.

Reviews.Title: “Reception Service Poor!”
Reviews.Author: saramarsdenille
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times now, and each time the service from the staff has been exceptionally poor. The hotel itself is more than adequate, very much top-notch Holiday Inn standard. It is modern, clean, has a nice pool and provides a great breakfast service. It is quite well-located being on the fringes of Playa. During our last stay here, we booked online before arriving at the hotel, as we wanted a speedy check-in. Unfortunately, when we arrived the hotel did not appear to have received the booking via Expedia. The staff were not especially helpful and had us waiting for nearly 30 minutes at the reception desk without apology, whilst they tried to track down our booking. The two young men on reception were definitely lacking in the customer service element of hospitality, to the point I felt it was almost downright rude! We also had an altercation in the following morning with one of these gentleman 'Omar' when we were leaving. My husband asked Omar to order us a taxi mini-bus as we had a lot of luggage. Their courtesy shuttle bus pulled up and their driver loaded our luggage and was ready to take us down to the ferry. We thought Omar had called the driver, but he then made the driver unload the luggage, telling us we had to get a taxi and that the courtesy minibus was not for travel to the ferry dock. Even the driver seemed surprised. So we asked (yet again) for Omar to order a taxi, and 10 minutes later a small taxi-car pulls up! Useless as we had about 10 bags with us. Luckily the taxi-driver managed to radio and sort a taxi bus for us. This experience certainly tainted our perception of the Holiday Inn at Playacar, and I do not think we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option For Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: sav260
Reviews.Content: This is a great option for a stay in Playa del Carmen. Its located right next to the air strip in Playa and right on the road that connects Playa with Cancun and Chetumal. Be warned that you are not next to the beach but the hotel makes up by having a shuttle that takes you to two different beach clubs at schedule times for drop off and pick up. Rooms are big, beds are very comfortable and the ground are immaculate. The breakfast does the job to fill you up before you go out for the day. The front desk people are very helpful and knowledgeable; when we asked for recommendation for places to eat (El Fogon and La Bamba Harocha) they were always spot on and even when we were in the need for a place to wash clothes they told us were to go ( Maya Lav). We would stay here again with out a question.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: temple1120
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times since opened two years ago. Nice rooms, staff a bit slow, but nice. Rooms are all new and clean. Try to get an up-grade to a suite, very nice & large. Pool, is Ok, not near the beach. We use as a one night stop en-route to Chetumal. Good breakfast. Another good value for less than $100 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WayfaringPair
Reviews.Content: We wanted to avoid the busy scene of a Saturday arrival at Cancun airport, and found we could save a large amount on our flight as well by leaving on Thursday. We chose the HIE in PdC, as we would switch to our timeshare just south of there 2 days later. We enjoyed the clean room, the continental breakfast, and great help from the concierge. We enjoy walking, so we explored PdC and 5th Avenue without using a cab, If you need a store for snacks or more, Chedraui (like Target) is close. We ate at Rolandis and Casa Adela's, and know there are other fine restaurants, such as La Perilla, also in PdC.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what others have stated”
Reviews.Author: ERCUR
Reviews.Content: No, it is not on the beach, but an extremely clean hotel. Not a 'resort' type setting, so if that's what you are looking for, this isn't for you, you will be dissappointed.. We knew we'd be doing day trips to Akumal, etc.. so figured this would work out for us and it did perfectly. Staff very accomodating, as soon as I asked for something - towles, etc.. they were brought up to room within minutes..Decent spread for breakfast - mix of Mexican and American offerings. I noticed there were people waiting to replenish the fruits, etc.. as soon as trays on buffet became empty. Hot foods (eggs, etc..) were hot. The hot chocolate is wonderful!! The shuttle DOES leave when it is supposed to (don't have to wait around for it, etc..). I can understand why there is no shuttle back from beach. They use a lovely new mini-van that would get trashed with sand, bathing suits, etc. Beach Club (coco maya) appears to be one of the older beach clubs, not as fancy as some of the others and you can't swim directly in front of it (boats docked there), but the staff there were wonderful and they make the best fish tacos.!! Their beer was a little on the high side but just pack a cooler back with store bought corona's and you'll be all set. They didnt' seem to have a problem with us having our own drinks.. We stayed four nights with teens and thoroughly enjoyed it. Pool out back was refreshing to sit by in the afternoon for an hour or so. Wish there were more seating options out back thoug and that we could have sat out side after returning from dinner but they close the pool area at 10 - my guess is so there are no noise issues with guests. This appeared to be a hotel geared toward tourists and local business travellers. No problems with college kids making noise, etc..I suspect that would not be tolerated here.. Next trip to Playa would gladly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for one night”
Reviews.Author: betonic
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel and we very pleased. We got a great price and expected very little. The rooms are basic but were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel is not located near the beach or shopping/restaurants so we wouldn't stay there for more than a couple nights. I was thrilled with everything about our stay until we went to the breakfast buffet that's included. The options are very limited and once I saw moldy bread I was grossed out so we decided to head somewhere else for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: wallyaussi
Reviews.Content: I go to Playa often and usually stay in one of the in town properties. I had not previously chosen the H I because it is a little out of the center. This trip ( Feb14-19) I went there because it was the best value I could find. I am glad that I did . The room was large with a king bed ( 2 types of pillows); a work table with a LAN plug; an armoire with TV (some English channels); an an OK sized bathroom (with a coffee maker) with a shower. VERY clean. The included breakfast was fine and always replaced when low; coffee, juice, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, sweet rolls, toast bread, pancakes, scrambled eggs, and frijoles. They have a decent sized pool (and towels) with some tables and lounges. They offer a beach shuttle to town 6 times a day and you can go to one of the "beach clubs" and use their area without paying. Of course they hope that you will buy some food and drink at the restaurant. I used this shuttle to get to the bus station for my trip back to the airport. Location- Take a right turn out of the lobby and it is a 12 minute walk from the hotel to the edge of town, and then another 5 minutes to 5th Avenue. Take a left turn and it is 5 minutes to a big supermarket and then 12 minutes to the bus station and 5th Ave. They also have WiFi which works in the breakfast room and the lobby. 2 small things: the ice machine is behind the front desk so you have to go down there when you want ice. There are no small fridges in the rooms. Overall- friendly staff and a good value. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “If they were on the beach they would have no vacancy!”
Reviews.Author: NCPuddin
Reviews.Content: Truthfully, my husband and I felt like we had should have paid more.... free breakfast is a buffet, very nice rooms, grounds, pool and professional helpful staff. We felt very much at home browsing about this hotel and the city areas too. As I said, they don't have a beach but the pool area is very nice with palm trees. The beach is blocks away. We use this hotel as a fill in before/after a week somewhere else on the beach. We stay here every time we are in the area and have had no negative experiences to report. Relax and enjoy staying here in wonderful Playa Del Carmen... ready to return : )

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel with a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: winnydpu
Reviews.Content: We stayed six days at this hotel with a 17 month old toddler. As they are at pains to tell you, this is a typical business class holiday inn express. So, no lunch or dinner, and no real entertainment. No problem, that's what we were looking for. The room was large and very clean. Typical of the climate, the floors are tile and not carpet. Good selection of english and spanish channels on the TV. Internet access was free and fairly fast (bring a patch cable or borrow one from the front desk with a deposit). Very quiet room. Water pressure was a little low in the shower, but we always had plenty of hot water. The typical free breakfast of the Holiday Inns was greatly improved on. Refritos, tortillas in a salsa verde, fruits, yoghurt and pastries were available, and all were good. The apparently have an arrangement with a Holiday Inn property on the beach, such that you can use the private beach of that property. We did not try this, but we did freely borrow the beach towels they provided. Seemed like a great value to us, as long as you were not planning on this being a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay and very reasonable rates!”
Reviews.Author: Kudalayd
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Playa a day earlier than our expected arrival at the Grand Mayan and needed a place to stay for one night, nothing really expensive. I was pleasantly surprised at the nice accomodations offered at the Holiday Inn Express - closer to Playacar than Playa del Carmen. The rate was around $56 or $57 US - with tax it came to less than $70US....and that included breakfast! Since we had a rental car, parking was important to us. Parking was included for free with ample space. The rooms were nice, very clean! There's a small shopping center not far from the hotel so we were able to replace our confiscated toothpaste without much difficulty. There was a small pool behind the lobby and a small exercise room. All in all....this was a little jewel! I'd highly recommend this hotel. And...the beds were better than the Grand Mayan where we spent a week! Go figure how a small hotel chain can have better beds!

Reviews.Title: “OK it might be a bit out of the way, but there are positives!!”
Reviews.Author: scammedbrit
Reviews.Content: We have used this Hotel for two years since 2008 and are now happily looking forward to a third visit in 2010! Basically this hotel ticks all the boxes if you are looking for cheap,clean rooms and friendly staff. OK its located on the edge of town, but the hot spots and restuarants are only 5 minutes away by taxi and if you have a hire car there are many cheap parking options in town which undercut the cost of a return taxi fare. The hotel will usually have links with a "beach club" which will save you about 100 pesos per person per day for lounger hire, they also provide towels. The hotel provides shuttle transport to the designated beach club but you do need to be a bit proactive in booking this service at reception. If you take the courtesy bus down in the morning then expect to be looking for a taxi back later in the day (650 pesos) If you have a hire car then take advantage of the car parks, reception staff will tell you where the cheapest options are. !0 minutes walk away from the hotel is the Chedraui hypermarket, this sells just about everything and is an excellent source for picnic food and even an in room evening meal. The breakfast option available at the Holiday Inn is good, but a bit limited. There is a really nice area out back around the swimming pool where I have spent many happy hours in the early morning planning the day and watching the wildlife. If you have a hire car, the hotel is convenient for access to all routes to Tulum, Coba, Cancun and just about everywhere on the main highway. The only downer is that the staff operating the in house tourist desks in this hotel tend to be linked to big timeshare companies such as the Sunset Group . Please be aware that that any reduced price/or free excursions offered in exchange for a 90 minute presentation will result in your being subject to at least 5 hours plus of hard sales techniques until you finally may be persuaded to part with hard earned cash for a package that is effectively useless.....you have been warned. If looking for excursions there are plenty available on Avenida Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean hotel but not that near the centre”
Reviews.Author: cardiffslim
Reviews.Content: nice clean room. looks very new and was much bigger than other rooms we stayed in in Mexico. was a bit out of the way but there is a shuttle bus to the beach and town. was 10 mins walk to some places to eat on avenida juarez, so no big deal. wifi was only available in the lobby which didn't have aircon on, so was a bit warm there at times. all in all, good hotel for the price if you're not bothered about being a bit out of the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smallcatoh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and had freindly staff. Not well suited for someone without a car. About a 2 to 3 minute dirve to the main area of Playa and Walmart. Could walk to McDonalds. The breakfast was adequate but not great. The hotel does have a tour person on-site and they are friendly and helpful with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel. Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: redwings1919
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremly well kept. Rooms were very clean. Pool area was nice. Its a 10 minute walk to fifth ave and the beach. The walk isnt bad like i have read in other reviews. Cab ride is about 40 to 50 pesos. This was my third visit to this hotel. Front desk staff is very helpfull and always glad to see you back.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been excellent if it was not for the chemical odor”
Reviews.Author: sunloverinatlanta
Reviews.Content: Hotel was almost too clean. Pervasive smell of cleaner. Almost overpowering when you first open the door to the room and the fan has not been running. No balconies so hard to air out the room. If you have respiratory issues or are sensitive to these things, stay somewhere else. Otherwise it was great. Standard modern hotel room. When in the room you can't tell whether you are in Atlanta, New York or Mexico. Exactly what you would expect for Holiday Inn Express here in the U.S. Fantastic location as long as you are not trying to walk to the beach. We were going to Xcaret after our first night and airport after second night. We had rental and drove to restaurants and 5th so it was perfect for what we needed. Breakfast is good with eggs, nachos, refried beans, fruit, great sweet rolls, cereal, toast, juice, coffee, etc. Free internet in the room if you remember your ethernet cord, otherwise wifi in business center along w/ a few computers provided. Very friendly staff. Concierge service service for this price? Wow. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Failed to honor their quoted price”
Reviews.Author: cudabob
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean but failed to honor quoted price when hotel filled up with golfers. Day before arrival I requested daily rate from front desk. Was quoted $75 US per day, so guaranteed room with card. Stayed 2 nights and at check out was handed bill for more than double quoted rate, 4566 pesos. Argued issue but to no avail. Was told that because there was a golf tourney happening that week the prices doubled.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value In Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: canyonexplorer76
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed overnight at the Holiday Inn Express Playacar Riviera Maya in Playa Del Carmen Mexico. We had a week booked at a resort near Puerto Aventuras but we arrived a day early and needed someplace inexpensive to spend the night and the Holiday Inn Express in Playa Del Carmen was just what we were looking for. Yes, this hotel is a little outside of the main tourist area but if you don't mind walking a bit then you should have no problem if you choose to stay here. Its about a 10 - 15 minute walk to the 5th Avenue area in Playa Del Carmen. The hotel does have a scheduled shuttle to take you into town but since we don't mind walking we did not take advantage of the shuttle. You can also get a taxi into town and back to the hotel for about 40 - 50 pesos each way. The hotel is just off of Highway 307 but its set back far enough that you don't hear any noise from traffic going by. The walk into town is pretty much a straight shot down the road from the hotel. There was some ongoing building construction down the street from the hotel and it looks like there will be some retail shops and restaurants going in there eventually so those will definitely be positive factors for anyone staying at the hotel in the future. Don't worry about noise from the construction. The hotel is just far enough down the street that you won't have to worry about any construction noise. Although our stay was short in duration we slept well and there was no noise or other disturbances with the exception of Tropical Storm Ida which passed through the area the night of our stay but it was no big deal and we barely noticed. The rooms are above average in my opinion. We found our room to be quite spacious. The floors are tiled and there was also a table/work area with chairs. There was also a safe in the room which had an electronic lock. There is no additional fee to use the safe as its included in your room cost. The air conditioning worked good also. The bathroom was your average hotel bathroom and met our needs perfectly. Tiled shower stall and good water pressure. Our entire room was absolutely spotless and among the cleanest rooms I have ever stayed in. The hotel lobbies and hallways were just as clean as the room. A free continental breakfast is included and consisted of muffins, croissants, cold cereals, scrambled eggs, toast, and a selection of juices and coffees/teas. Its not a huge breakfast buffet but it is more than adequate to get you started for the day with a quick meal. Service at the hotel was great. Check in took about 2 minutes and then we were on the elevator up to our room. We needed to get a taxi to get to our resort the next day and the front desk clerk was more than happy to help us out and called and arranged for a taxi to pick us up at the time we requested. We didn't use the pool so I can't comment on that part of the hotel. If you don't mind staying a little outside of the downtown tourist area and don't mind walking 10 or so minutes to get to the main tourist area then I highly recommend this hotel. You can't go wrong for the price. We'll be returning to Mexico later this year and we've decided to come down a few days longer this time and we've already booked 4 nights at the Holiday Inn Express in Playa Del Carmen to start off our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: vidtrans
Reviews.Content: The first impression of the area is not good if you`re coming from Cancun or the airport.Big busy road under construction during our visit. As soon as you turn into the parking lot things improve.Beautiful spotless hotel. The staff is constantly cleaning the place even when it`s already clean. The rooms are basic but immaculate and functional. The staff is friendly.There is a free breakfast buffet which is o.k. but can get boring after a few days.The breakfast area is quite large and pleasant.The pool is beautiful but shallow and there is a small fitness room with a few treadmills and step machines. The business center has three computers and one printer and Wi-Fi is available in the lobby only.They will lend you a wire for free internet in your room. The main street and beach is about a 7-10 minute walk away or you can take the free one way shuttle.(check the schedule) There are a few negatives: There are no fridges in the rooms except the suites.That`s strange in such a hot climate. To add to this problem there is no ice available on the floors.They make you go to the reception desk who in turn calls someone else who then goes to a secret hiding place and comes back several minutes later with that precious commodity. Another odd thing is that they won`t cash travellers checks. Be careful about the location of the room they give you.Mine was next to their laundry room which has very loud machines constantly going on and off.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vaule in Playa”
Reviews.Author: cybertommy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located off the main Playa 5th Ave strip. There's a mexican supermarket nearby and 2 decent Mexican Restaurants (VIPS and El Portinos). VIPS is more like a Dennys and El Portinos is more like Acapulco/El Torritos. El Portinos does deliver to the hotel in case you get lazy and doesn't want to walk in the sun. The breakfast was great, it was same bacon, eggs, refried beans, chilliquilles, everyday. However, I cannot complain since it was tasty and filling and get you through the morning before the tour van picks you up. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. The beach club is at Coco Maya Beach club. The shuttle is not that often, however, you can take a cab there for about 50 pesos. We did walked back from the beach club and it wasn't that bad of a walk in the evening. All in all, its a good value for your money and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: carlos_canada
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location Excellent Real State Excellent Rooms Excellent Break-fast Excellent Swimming Pool Excellent Value! Clean Ample Close to everything Safe Enjoy It!

Reviews.Title: “So much value! Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rafabos
Reviews.Content: Ok, if you are not looking to spend a week of pay on a hotel stay this is the perfect place/location. Let me start by saying that you can literally eat your 3 meals on the floor of this hotel! its is so EXTREMELY clean! I was impressed! Plus there is breakfast which has local food like refried beans and corn tortillas with cheese and salsa! also: Excellent coffee, real hot chocolate, cerals, 2 types of juice, yougurt, pastries... and of course eggs! trust me you wont leave hungry! - they also have a pool with chairs which does the trick in case you dont want to leave the hotel! in case you feel like hitting the beach there is a shuttle a different time in the morning that will take you to a beach club called Coco Maya - you get in for free and choose your bed or chair with shade or not right in front of the beach! for free! - the hotel provides towels so you wont have to pay for one! - Coco Maya is only one of the many beach clubs... but I found service and prices of food and beer to be competitive with the rest of the beach. The hotel also has 3 computers for internet. The beds are soft and perfect, the sheets are neat and clean each day and the shower is just wonderful! We spent 7 days here for $us 42.50 per day and we couldnt have picked a better place! its a 5 minute tops walk to the 5th ave area, but a cab wont cost you more than 3 dollars!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not the best price”
Reviews.Author: yank4ever
Reviews.Content: this is a nice medeaoker 3 star hotel, but its in a great location. its a 5 minute walk to 5th ave. which is the center of it all. it has a big but shallow 3 foot pool. th rooms are nice but i would advise you to walk around and book a hotel that way rather then booking one on line, being that anything you do there will be cheaper in person.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: catyap
Reviews.Content: Very good, quiet, clean, contemporary/updated decor for such an affordable price. Daily breakfast. Has a pool, fitness area, business center, and wi-fi. One would need a car to stay in this location (which we already planned due to daily travel), though cabs can be hailed. It's just about a mile or so from the tourist zone, perfectly away from the hustle and bustle. Daily (room) housekeeping does a great job! One thing that would have made it more perfect is if massage service could be given in the hotel instead of having to go to the beach resort.

Reviews.Title: “great value!”
Reviews.Author: pandababy51
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The distance wasnt a problem. we either walked 15 min or took the complimentary shuttle to 5th ave and took a cab back at night around $5 including tip. for what you pay for, the hotel is clean, provided free internet service, and breakfast which i loved (eggs, bacon, nachos, refried beans, toast and hot chocolate!) . the advantage to living a distance from 5th ave is the quietness at night (some of the hotels in 5th ave are right next to the noisy bars). also if you want to save more money there is a mega mart nearby, kinda like a costco for all your needs. there is a pool and gym room but why would anyone go there when they can visit the beach?

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Travelerdreamer
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from Playa Del Carmen..."really enjoyed the area, lots to do". Everything was great no compliments. However the location is a few minutes walk to 5th Avenue and the beach. There is a free shuttle to the beach in the mornings but you generally will have to walk back to the hotel or take a cab which was 50 pescos during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience on a hotel in a very long time”
Reviews.Author: NzJpp
Reviews.Content: terrible, sterile hotel. we asked and were charged for a room with 3 beds to suit 3 adults. were given a roll out bed that felt like sleeping on reinforcing steel. they refused to do anything, even though we had paid the equilivent of two rooms. There are WAY better places closer to the town with more character for less. Do not waste your time here. Its too far from the town & the curtosy shuttle was 'broken down`the entire time we were here-I doubt it exists. Also airconditioning plant runs 24h and is very noisy. worst holiday in express experience ever

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Unexpectedly great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ALKGrandForks_ND
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Great price, clean rooms, friendly staff, free breakfast, good breakfast, free use of towels, free use of beach club (Coco Maya), free use of safe (we've had to pay before), nice pool, treadmills and bikes in gym (that's it though), 3 computers with internet access (usually in use), only about 3/4 of a mile walk to 5th Ave (we usually walked) Con's: no restaurant or bar, shuttle only leaves 5 or so times a day for 5th Ave and beach club Good hotel for everyone but families with small children - the shuttle can't really accommodate large families as the shuttle doesn't make more than 1 trip at any departure time, so families would need to get a van taxi if taking strollers, etc. to 5th or the beach.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: cred68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday inn Playacar for 5 nights in February 2009.The hotel is good and we payed only 60 american dollars per night and per rooms with breakfast and all taxes. There are free parking lot and internet too.The rooms are large and well equipped.The breakfast is basic but good. The hotel is a twenty minutes walking to Fifth Avenue and to the Playa del Carmen beach but we never felt unsafe on the way. So, it´s a good hotel to stay when in Playa del Carmen.I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The hurricane didn't even bother me there”
Reviews.Author: AmateurCritic
Reviews.Content: Overall very nice. Clean, attractive and apparently well-run. I was there the night Hurricane Dean hit and the only adverse effect was that the buffet was set up an hour late the next morning! If you like Holiday Inn Express hotels in the States, you’ll probably like this one too. I’d definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The good the bad and the ripoff”
Reviews.Author: cervaza
Reviews.Content: Our first night at the holiday inn express playacar they put us in a handicapped room, we phoned the front desk and asked for a regular toilet seat, they sent a maintenance man that didn't speak english, the next morning we asked to be moved into a standard room because the room was really musty and we couldn't get a regular toilet seat (kinda funny). When we got into our new room it was musty as well, but not to bad, they only have picture windows so you can't let fresh air in, I opened the door for a few minutes a day, that seemed to help, plus the airconditioner removed the humidity, although the maids would come in and shut off the airconditioning and when returning at the end of the day it was a little warm. The first night sleeping in our bed, i noticed that the sheets and pillows stunk, it was like the linens had been left wet for a day and a few days later i noticed a clean towel smelt the same. The pillows are like couch cushions, small and square, my husband said it was like sleeping on a balloon, they look very nice, but not very practical. Breadfast was good, scrambled eggs, cereal, toast, pastry, yogurt, fruit and sometimes bacon. We had trouble at the excaret park, we planned to pay our admission fee with our credit card but the card wouldn't work, so we scrounged enough money to get into the park, once we were in the park we went straight to the atm (money machine) to withdraw $100.00 CDN, we could here the machine counting the money, we waited and waited, then my card came out and a receipt but no money, we probably spent 4 hours trying to get scotia banks attention to resolve this matter. When we got back to the hotel we tried to phone Bank of Montreal Mastercard and couldn't get an outline, I phoned the front desk and asked her if she could help connect me to an operator, that i would pay with my calling card, she tried but couldn't get an outline, so she sent a maintenance man to our room, he couldn't speak english, he replaced the phone, and the same thing happened, I then realized that you would have to get the front desk to open the line, I phoned the next day and the new girl at the desk said she needed my credit card to open the line. (learn spanish before going to mexico). The Hotel advertised a smart lounge and they play music friday, saturday and sunday, it didn't happen while we were there and I don't know what the smart lounge was, no alcochol served. (probably a good thing, it keeps the hotel quiet). The walk to the beach is approximately 20 minutes, the first hotel shuttle leaves at 10:30 am and they don't bring you back to the hotel, a taxi is approximately $5.00 u.s. Make sure your money isn't ripped because they won't take it. The hotel is very modern , very clean and the staff are very friendly, they don't speak much english. When I returned home I immediately contacted the bank of montreal regarding the money machine at xcaret park and believe it or not, I was given my money back, it took a couple of weeks and they have a freeze on it till march 28, 2009. I received my mastercard statement and I noticed the Holiday Inn Express Playacar charged an extra $150.00 CDN, to my mastercard, they didn't advise us of any extra charges when we checked out and we were not notified by mail or telephone of any extra charges being charged to our creditcard, todate I am still trying to get the charge reversed, I phoned Holiday Inn Express Customer Care and advised them of the problem, they sent a fax to the H.I. Playacar and the staff at H.I. Playacar told them that they didn't know what they were talking about, I asked customer care if they had someone that could speak spanish and they advised me that it is their policy to send a fax. I then tried to phone Holiday Inn Express Playacar, I was put on hold, I was hung up on and then they didn't understand what i ment, I asked for the manager and was told he was out for lunch, this was late in the day, then I finally spoke to someone who could speak english, we checked out of the hotel January 28/09 and todate (march 18/09) we have not received our credit and Holiday Inn Express will not contact me after sending 10 emails asking them to let me know what is going on. The day we checked out of the hotel, my thoughts were," I will stay here again" even though there were a few flaws, but because of the mastercard problem i will never stay there again. In closing, the reason why we choose the Holiday Inn Express was because they are well known and we didn't want to be shafted. (BOY DID WE PICK THE WRONG HOTEL).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Facility-WILL COME BACK AGAIN-THANK YOU”
Reviews.Author: rhondave
Reviews.Content: We were here last year at this time. Just off of HWY 307, a short walk to the town. Very clean and safe location because it is just off the highway and adjacent to the interior roads (gated) that lead to the Playacar Resorts and Casa's just to the South. Upon check-in we received an upgrade due to my Holiday Platinum Status (even though my rooms were free with points) and the Sute was actually 2 rooms which included King bed and Bath (shower only), 2 large closets and safe. The seperate room had additional TV and large buffett and table and chairs, Leather couch would have made into second sleeping area if needed. There is complimentary breakfast of course and front desk staff always available to help. The pool area is great and faces the South which gives those trying to sunbath more time before the sun goes down. The front desk can arrange for your return transportation to the airport and in fact our taxi driver drove down from Cancun @ 500AM and called us the night before we left to confirm our needs. Thanks Gustavo Garza and Karla? and all of your staff for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Isle 'n Sun
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express – Playa del Carmen/Playacar Odd - this hotel claims to be #1 voted for shower!? The shower is NOT #1, nor anyting else about the place Positive 1. General cleanliness (room, lobby, common areas) very good to excellent 2. Grounds and pool area good to very good. 3. Overall appearance, very good. 4. Rooms quiet and comfortable (good bed, many pillows, and spacious) 5. A/C very good 6. Internet – strong signal 7. Sam’s close and so is supermarket (note Sam’s not where map shows) Negative 1. Breakfast – not as advertised. No meat on some days, or very little. 2. Rooms have internet but not wifi. If no cable you will have to trot to the lobby. 3. General observation – seems like hotel may not have revenue stream to support guests. A number of ‘little’ things not around. 4. Holiday Inn Express is a good distance from 5th and 10th Aveunes. There are NO bars or places to eat near to the Holiday Inn Express. And the HIE does not have a bar (BYOB). Only food is a vending machine. It was 90+% empty. 5. Check-in. There was a problem with me reservation. Could have been easily fixed. Took numerous phone calls to USA, one from USA booking company to hotel front desk (that did not fix problem). Summary, wasted 3 hours 6. This lodging seems sterile. No Mexican music, art, colors, etc. Seems more like an American hotel. Little/no character. Certainly will not get you in the mood for the rest of the country. Thoughts on Holiday Inn Express – Playa del Carmen/Playacar It has a sterile feel. Not much character, no music, no bar, no restaurant, no Mexican feel. I walked back and forth to 5th avenue. It is a hike. But doable. Is likely a good stopover if you are heading south from Cancun airport to Tulum and points south. As for staying in Playa del Carmen. Look harder for lodging closer to 5th and 10th Ave. A Mexican flavor hotel. Close to restaurants, bars, etc. My summary of this lodging is Neutral. Would use again. But, I would search for alternate places. Especially considering cost of Holiday Inn Express. Did HIE for 4-nights. Moved to hotel on 30th Ave for 7-nights. It is Mexican and very good. 450 pesos a night (total). Dorymar. Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money but not as represented”
Reviews.Author: mw_sa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a last minute winter get-away trip after finding low cost flights to Cancun. I was looking for something inexpensive but nice. This hotel lived up to those requirements but it was not as represented on the hotel website. First of all the website said it was 5 blocks to their beach club, but in reality it was more like a mile or more to the beach club. Possibly this was because the beach club shown and named on the hotel website was not the one used when we were there. The website says BANG Club but it was the Coco Maya and it didn't have all the amenities as shown in the pictures on the wesite. The website said there was a complimentary local area shuttle for a radius of 3KM. In reality the shuttle was ONE-WAY to the beach club and a couple of other stops and it ran on a specified schedule. Therefore you had to wait for a scheduled time and either walk back or get a cab. We didn't mind this as we were willing to walk but it was not what I had expected. The breakfast was good and pretty much as expected. We are not coffee drinkers and really liked that they had REAL hot chocolate every day. Our room as well as the hotel in general was very clean although our room had a musty smell which I attributed to the humid conditions, but it caused my allergies to act up half way through our stay. If you are looking for an inexpensive place to stay that is clean and comfortable and don't mind walking this is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: superjojo
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay at this hotel again. The price was definitely agreeable - $60/night. The breakfast was great. The rooms were clean and the pool area was nice. It is a walk from the downtown area, but only 10 minutes. They have a shuttle to take you to 3 spots, but no return shuttles. The only problems I would have to say is, they do not supply you with enough towels in your room, almost as if they want you to call so they can make a tip off of you. They do not have accessible ice machines, you have to ask for it at the front desk. Very inconvenient.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Playacar Riviera Maya
HotelInfo.Address: Lt 5 Mz 29 Fracc Playacar, Playa del Carmen 77713, Mexico
